oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Marian Anderson, program for performance at Ryman
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Performing Identity
Musicians
African American singers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The front of the program for a performance by Marian Anderson at the Ryman Auditorium on February 5, 1932.
Marian Anderson was an African American contralto, and is most remembered for her 1939 performance on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D.C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Nashville Public Library, Special Collections, Naff Collection
